The PS4 is a very impressive piece of hardware, and heralds Sony's return to the front ranks of the video game market, but the launch edition is not without its share of glitches.I can report that I too experienced problems with the HDMI out on the console. I initially saw a black screen. After plugging and unplugging the HDMI connection, and turning off the console a few times, the picture popped back on, but it would go black and come back on over and over.I eventually tried another  HDMI cable I had laying around, and that worked just fine. No problem since. But it is clear that the issue is the console's HDMI port, which seems poorly made and prone to glitches. I hope it behaves from now on.The console itself is as advertised. It is a sleek, small, visually impressive little console that seems to have been elegantly designed. It is fairly quiet and does not emit a lot of heat.I already replaced the hard drive in favor of a larger unit, which was as easy as pulling back the cover with my hands and unscrewing four phillips head screws. This is something many will want to do, as hard drive space fills up quickly.The console, like the PS3, still takes forever to load new games because it uses the hard drive to stream the data, but once gameplay begins it is very smooth and visually impressive.The biggest knock on the hardware design is probably the tiny off/on button and eject button in the front. These are almost microscopic and a real pain to use at first. But fortunately you can use the controller to power off the console.All in all I would highly recommend the console, but be forewarned that you may have to deal with some glitches/patches if you buy the launch edition. This is par for the course with a new console launch, but it bears mention to those who would rather not deal with this kind of aggravation to test out the latest tech. Such people likely will want to wait a few months.
I bought this console for my son and he loves it! Great price too!

If you hated the PS3 you will love the PS4.  The console does an excellent job staying out of your way by self-managing all downloads and installs.  Game installs take less than a minute and will continue while playing the game.  It is really easy and fast jumping from game to game.  It takes the frustrations out of the equation by jumping right into your game with very short launch times.  PSVita Remote Play works flawlessly including my test of having the PS4 in NJ and the PSVita in NYC.Now on to the bad parts.  500GB isn’t going to last long.  I have replaced mine with a HTGC 1TB 7,200RPM HDD.  I have filled 1/5th the 500GB drive or 1/10th the 1TB drive.  For the average consumer this will be an issue.  The Console’s System Software can be buggy at times.  I have had the PS4 lock up during a Remote Play session and required someone to physically unplug it remotely.  PSN has a lot of hiccups during the first week of system launch.  Music Unlimited is a horrible service.  Has issues with slow load speeds, stopping music randomly and very poor UI.  Sony is releasing an update that will MP3 and CD support.  This will remove the need for Music Unlimited.  Wish Sony would work with Spotify or rdio to make a PS4 compatible app.  I don’t see why they can’t since Netflix competes with Video Unlimited service.The games come very close to PC capable graphics.  This is coming from a person who owns a GTX 690 and can run all PC games at max settings.Overall highly recommend the PS4 I have a feeling that this will be the rebirth of the PS2 era.

Excellent gaming performancePS Vita Remote Play over WiFiAlright, the stuff that truly matters. The PlayStation 4 is indeed a graphical step up from the PlayStation 3 and the Xbox 360. The games look very good, and everything loads quite quickly. Beyond the speedy, one time install when you first pop in a new game, it's hard to even notice the loading times. There's nothing that even comes close to the disconcertingly long load up of the PS3's The Last of Us.The graphics are good, but not mind blowing. If you've played on a PC that costs two or three times what a PS4 goes for, you've seen as good, if not slightly better.(im a pc gamer and i see big diference between both still pc rules )Sony gave away online multiplayer for free with the PlayStation 3, but you could opt for PlayStation Plus status for digital store discounts and other perks. Now the arrival of the PS4, Sony has given the PSN a major renovation, and introduced a paywall for online multiplayer.(which it sucks that you have to play for multiplayer)nevertheless enjoy this device , and the most interesting line up comes from Sony's own studios which make top quality games

The only reason I'm not giving a solid 5 star yet is because I am still waiting to see how future games play...but so far, it's very slick.I'm sure by the time new games come out,that really take advantage of the technology, I'll be singing the 5 star praises.As many have said here... I love the controller. It fits my hands like second-skin. The camera works well but still waiting for more games to see what comes from that.I really like the live streaming of games and interacting with other players..again, once more games are released, that feature is going to be sweet. Oh...and the share button is flawless.I've watched some BluRay movies on it and it might be my imagination, but the picture looks even better (Man of Steel looked flipping awesome!). Netflix and all movie apps work just as expected.I like being able to download while other things are happening and having more than one application open at once.I could go on and on with good stuff...the only bad thing for the moment is that there's not enough games-but that'll change. Also, I wish that I could play ps3 games on it--like GTA5.I plan on buying an xbox one as well to have a fair comparison to both systems. I had the 360 as well as the ps3 before and enjoyed both but found myself on ps3 more.I'm looking forward to see what future games and systems updates are like, but so far, this is a fantastic buy.

The system is very fast and responsive with a clean interface/OS that is easy to use.  The gaming graphics are excellent and better than the PS3 but not outstanding enough to "wow" you but I am sure it will in the coming months/years with newer games that can take advantage of the raw power.  Playstation Plus is also a great feature ($50/year) that gives you the capability of online gaming along with free games (select titles of course).  The online gaming works perfectly as I have not experienced any lag or disconnect.  I never used my PS3 for online gaming so I do not know how it is improved but the PS4 online gaming definitely works better than my Xbox 360.  I haven't tried my Xbox One for online gaming yet but that is moot in this review.There are a few things that I do not like about the PS4 that gives it 4 out of 5 stars instead of a perfect score.  The system does not support 3D Blu ray.  I still use my PS3 for that which is fine but you would expect the 3D feature out of the box (with the 1.5 system update) on a newer Sony product.  The system does not recognize my USB 3.0 1TB external hard drive when plugged in.  I have a few 4K demonstrations on the hard drive that I would like to see on my 4K TV but the system does not support external hard drives.  After a ton of research, it turns out that the PS4 does not support 4K video out of the box anyway so my 4K demos wouldn't even display in 4K if the hard drive worked.Also, after about a half hour of game play, the internal fan is blowing at full speed and is seriously loud.  It sounds like a jet from a distance.  I can understand why because the system gets insanely hot.  I mean, the PS4's extremely hot temperature and loud fan noise makes me think that maybe I have a defective unit.  Does anyone who owns a PS4 have the same heating and fan noise issue.  Please let me know.
It works but mine didn't come with a controller, I haven't been able to use it fully yet.

I would appreciate the option to upload it to dropbox so that we can access the material on other devices-As of now there is no customization of the UI.

So I had the option to preorder from a store and wait for it to be in stock, or just order from Amazon. I would definitely recommend the later. It seems everyone ordering from amazon receives their PS4 much quicker than waiting for a local store. I ordered it, and received it in about 4 days. I gotta say, i love it! Coming from an Xbox360, its such a big and dramatic change. Graphics, UI, processing, all so much better! Looking back on the 360, I can't believe what a change it is. I would recommend a PS4 over all other systems, including xbox one. You won't be disappointed!

First off, I think this thing looks way better in person than it did in pictures, very sleek. Compared to the Xbox One, it's very trim. Playstation's new controller is amazing the analog sticks, weight, and handfeel are all superb. The PS4's packaging is very simple, very similar to a laptop, no frills. Setup was easy, admittedly it took me a bit to find the power, eject button and the disc slot. Games install very fast, faster than Xbox one (at least the ones I tried). PS4's current background isn't customizable and is fairly stripped down, compared to Xbox One's fully customizable and very developed, but almost crowded home page. Setting up a PS+ account was easy as was finding my friends. Overall I was very pleased with the look of the console, the feel of the controller and playing online with my friends!

The PS4 was for my grandson and I assume he's happy with it. What made me so happy was Amazons outstanding job at getting it to me before Christmas. They are the greatest company to deal with EVER!!!!!
ok

The graphics for this item are extraordinary!  I may be biased in saying that as I have ever Playstation device that has ever been released.  I find that the PS4 is a setup in the next direction to gaming!

I've been wanting a PS4 for years and I finally got it. The price was great. And it didn't come with all those extra games that I didn't want. Just the console and a controller. Just what I wanted. The packaging was great and it arrived safely. I also swapped out the 500GB hard drive for a 1TB.
my son love it
Great upgrade to the ps3, although i still have my ps3 for 3d blue ray movie collection and great ps3 games.  The new exclusives for the ps4 are just fantastic, must owns.

I am one of the unlucky .4% I suppose, but I refuse to give this fine product a one star rating. I received it in a timely manner, and everything was working really well right out of the box. After about maybe 5 hours of use my system shut itself off and began to display the pulsing blue light issue. I tried all of the tips in the troubleshooting guide, and a few suggestions from youtube, but ultimately I could only ever to get it back to the dash if I entered safe mode first. In the end I called Sony, and I have to say I was blown away by how well they handled things. They are overnighting me a box and shipping me a brand new system.I'm removing one star because I had this issue at all, but the remaining four are for Amazon and Sony's excellent service.
This console starts with a lack of video games catalog, but I had to said this console is the most solid of this next generation. Just wait to see everything has to come in 2015.
I love the Ps4 and the shipping was spot on. I haven't had any problems with the console but I did add a 3 year warranty that was only $59.00

No issues at all so far. We bought the original day roll out system for Xmas with Assasins Creed, Battlefield and Killzone. Killzone is awesome. Every game looks next gen. Processor is powerful and graphics look great. Quiet. Cool. Zero issues. Controllers are really nice. Big upgrade. Get the camera. Future games will use it. It has some demo features with the camera that are great. If you dont want an Apple Style TV box that X-box One is trying to be.... and want a gamers system. This is it. Its also very easy to upgrade the hard drive to 1 Terrabyte if you want. Just look on YouTube. Its just a fast, excellent graphics, gamers system.
This console rocks!
works fine!
There's nothing to say that hasn't already been said. It's amazing. However, I'd wait to purchase unless you're an avid gamer, as title selection is limited for now. Very limited.

I have been using my launch PS4 a fair bit since it came in Friday.  I am very happy with my purchase on the whole, and I would like to document some of the features that I really appreciate.Firstly, the redesigned DualShock 4 controller is vastly superior to the previous controllers.  I really like how it feels in my hand and how responsive the triggers are.  I also really like the weight; it's a bit heavier than the sixaxis but lighter than a dualshock 3.  Overall, it hits all the important parts.I also want to mention that the console comes with a one-month trial of PS Plus and a 10 dollar PlayStation store code to help lower the cost of your first digital purchase.  Previous news outlets said the system would come with a 2 week pass, so the month was not expected and is appreciated.The last thing I really want to highlight is how nice it is to use the system as a bluray player.  I've used my PS3 for years to play movies, so I thought I'd try one in the PS4 to see how it changes.  Now, you have most common options tied to the option button instead of trying to navigate the little menu after pressing triangle.  It's kind of minor, but it really makes the system worth more to me. Also important is the fact that the disc drive is whisper quiet.Of course the graphics are impressive, but nothing really stands out that I feel is 'next-gen' yet.  But when you consider launch PS3 titles to ones I just finished playing last week, it is clear that there will be a pretty big jump in graphics as people learn to use the machine.I'm really happy I got it, and I plan to play it a lot in the coming weeks.

The PS4 is great, it's a wonderful upgrade from the PS3-MUCH Faster! Very easy to use and a fun gaming system-far better than the XBox One that has had nothing but glitches since we got it. Plus my "kid" was thrilled to get an early Christmas present...

Fast, easy to use, user friendly interface, and for that price, better then any PC you can buy.I'm very happy with my new playstation, the new joystick is good very comftorble, there are few problems with sticky R1 and L1 after some use, the problem solved after opening the controller and cleaning the under the buttons.Besides that great console, best in the market.

What can I say about the PS4 that hasn't already been said? It's awesome, it's sleek, it's powerful, and it has some amazing games in its library already! My console worked flawlessly right out of the box. Any gamer should get one!

Sony's epic failure on Christmas - and still 1 week later in one case - is the reason for the 2 star review. They were not honest about PSN being in "scheduled maintenance" when it was widely reported that they were hacked. Four days later and I STILL can not use my download code for the "pick one of four" promotion. After following instructions, they say that the code will below can be used, but the code is listed as "UNDEFINED". Then, someone on their support page listed this as solved so that you can't add to the list of people saying they are having a problem.To make matters even more laughable, once PSN came up ( still can't use code 4 days later ) , I wanted to start my free trial of PSN Plus. They had the NERVE to require my credit card information to start a trial. What a joke.If you can wait, I highly recommend that you do.

Delivered as promised on Launch Day. I actually waited to write this review to make sure there were no problems.Ps4 has no problems playing games or blue-ray dvds. Blown away by how good the graphics are. This is my first playstation, so I didn't know what to expect.Both online and disc games play flawlessly.
Very good price and fast shipping the inly problem, (which is not a big deal ) I didn't think I was buying a slim ps4
The system did not come with no cables or controller .. I had to go out and buy them.. turns out the system does not connect to WiFi and when I tried to connect the controller it would not  ...

I was on the fence on ordering this from Amazon with all the Negative reviews I was reading.. But decided to run with it. Overall I'm very pleased with my purchase.they need a little work on the packaging side of things.

Got it in on time. Clean packaging. My ps4 look brand new, no scratches or wear and tare. I don't think it has ever been used ( at least not the controller or cordes) I'm very excited to use it and for a killer price!

It's surprisingly small compared to the original Ps3.  It's quiet, comes with hdmi cable, and the new dual shock controller is really nice.The interface is nice, easy to read, very clean looking.I haven't had any problems with it so far.I previously had an Xbox 360 and Ps3 and liked the 360 more, but I made a choice to go with the Ps4 instead of Xbox One because it's more powerful and at the same time $100 cheaper.  I know the Xbox One comes with Kinect, but I think that should be an option because not everybody wants to play or need the camera.  I don't care for the multimedia capabilities I just want to play games and watch BR movies.I'm not giving 5 stars because so far it's lacking in the software department.  Most of the games that are available now is also available on other systems.  It's killer exclusive isn't such a killer (killzone - which hasn't had the greatest reviews).
Returned

This thing is totally awesome to the max and I'm glad I waited a few months to get it so that the teething problems could be ironed out, and they appear to be I haven't had any problems as of yet she runs smooth, cool and quiet and no problems with hand shaking, now the wait is on for the games because they only have like 5 games worth playing for me and 3 that are great the others are either kid games or sports games which I'm not into they don't suck I'm just not into them. Second son which comes out on the 21st should be good I hope. Anyway back to the console one other thing I like is that you can stream movies you own from Sony not download it to hard drive like in ps3 so that's great and saves hard drive space.

Bought it in nov. In mid dec. The blue light would turn on, then the system would turn off right away. Erased hard drive, it worked for bit, then the same thing happened, and it never turned back on. Shortage in power supply or something. First time i ever returned anything on amazon. Very disappointed.

its always on, it always has lights on it! you cant even tell if its off cuz it always has lights.it hards to turn it off, you need to click thru like 3 menus to turn it off, because it tries to go into the "stand by mode" unless you persist on shutting it off.  i couldnt even find the power button when i first got it home! it always cries if something happens like a power outage. the way you get and send xmb messages is terrible now. its terrible that you need to have psplus to play any games online now. it only has hdmi video output and it was very picky about which kind of hdmi wire i used i had to use the one it came with cuz several other ones i had did not work with it. the controller has a stupid light that is always on and seems to me that all its doing is draining the battery faster. i wear gloves when i use the controller cuz if i dont it feels like my pores of my skin are absorbing some kind of toxic substance like bpa or something from the plastic, seriously! (this is a legit thing look it up its confirmed they are using plastic with toxic substances in it).

Received my ps4 on launch day. My initial thoughts is that its very fast compared to ps3. I have had it for a week now and had no issues with a blinking blue light problem other people state. I guess I lucked out, but did check the HDMI port on ps4 and on cable that came with it to make sure there was no damage or the piece of metal sticking up in the hdmi port of ps4 that people claim cause this isssue.Pro's:1) games look great and the fact you can hop out of your game into the OS and then back into the game with out restarting the game is awesome.2) Live game streaming is a real cool feature for your friends or the general public. I found my self watching other people play games for a half hour. Some of those people are hilarious with there comments when I watched them play. It is also great to view a game you don't own yet to get a look at if you should buy it.3) PS+ is a great deal. I have already downloaded 5 games for free between my ps4 and vita.4) Vita remote play with ps4 is nice. It streams really good in my home wifi and even took the vita to work and streamed my games, and it worked pretty good. Granted I have 5mbs upload at home which probably helped.5) The playstation app is a great add on. I  primarily use it for the virtual keyboard when I am in the playstation store so I am not taking forever to search for something. Games also have there own companion app like for assassin's creed that has its own map for iPad that I had synced to my ps4. So every time I moved in the game it showed on the map on my iPad.Con's:1) I hope in future firmware updates they can have folders options because right now its one long line of apps and games id like to categorize it in future.2) the infamous wobble is there. I fixed it by putting a folded up piece of paper under the front left of the system which solved the problem.3) The fact you need to have facebook to upload videos really urks me. I dont really like facebook and rather not setup a account just to upload game videos. Hope in future update I can save these videos directly to my harddrive or even have a youtube upload option.Well I hope everyone else enjoys there ps4 and even xbox one people, I hope you enjoy your system to. Planning on getting that next year.
Great

I got a package deal that came with The Last of Us Remastered download, a year of Playstation Plus, and $10 gift card to the PS Store. I love this console. The home menu redesign is major improvement. Pausing the game and jumping to the home screen is easy and convenient. All I have to do is press the PS button. Playstation is leveling the field with Xbox. The touchpad for the controller is a neat feature. I like that I can use it to type; however, I prefer to use the motion feature when typing. I can use the controller like a Wii remote. It speeds up type time significantly. The graphics are amazing of course. Everything looks clean and crisp. The Last of Us really shines in this department. it's worth getting for the graphics alone. While I'm not thrilled I have to start paying to play online, it's not a surprise Playstation went this route. Xbox has done it for years. A year subscription is $10 cheaper than an Xbox sub so that's a plus. Overall, I'm happy with my PS4.
My stupid controls r aligned really weird and in fortnite you can’t change them, also when I put in mlb the show 18 it doesn’t even pop up or nothing!!!!

This is one amazing piece of hardware. And at launch it is a beast. I love the design, the controller is absolutely fantastic, and I can not stress how good it feels. The fan is dead silent and the UI is smooth and runs at a faster pace than the ps3. I am still waiting for Killzone to arrive from Amazon, but no worries, there was a lot to keep me busy. It comes with Blacklight Retribution which is excellent for a free FPS, and I'm still waiting for Warframe to dload. However the most fun I have had is with the broadcasting feature!! It is addictive to watch and interact with players live streaming their gameplay. You can loose hours just watching and conversing with fellow gamers, it is amazing. The PS4 is truly a homerun right out of the gate, something that the ps3 failed to do. This is a must buy console for any gamer regardless of fan boy allegiance. GAME ON my brothers and Sisters...GAME ON!!. See you online.
I stopped working after using it a month. Maybe it was refurbished.

Sipment arrived today, I was lucky enough to get in on launch day, but picked free shipping and had to wait until today..big mistake, but my bad.  Got a little worried about all the DOA reviews..I wonder if these are made up.The box from amazon wasn't enveloped in bubble wrap that's true.  In fact the box was almost partially open and the tape had been ripped part way.  When I opened the Amazon box, I noticed a corner of the PS4 box was crushed.  I thought for sure I would open the box to find the PS4 in pieces.No such trouble.  Followed the instructions, it powered right up and has run COD Ghosts and Battlefield 4 with no issues so far.The graphics are really good.  I think the sound is even richer in the games somehow as well. Really impressive and can't wait to see what games that are solely designed for this new platform.

This console is awesome, Its about better than the ps3 in every way. Its faster,sleeker,better graphics, and the controller wasn't made for little kids this time around.If you are a true gamer, you will get this console. Hopefully this helps any gamers out there trying to pick the right console.
Amazing! It was new and it's in excellent condition! The only thing I complain is that lasted a little bit to arrive. Still giving you five for the quality

I think this is better than my XboxOne counsel because it's easier to use. The only problem I have with the PS4 is that they shut down or freeze during gameplay at least once a day. I own three PS4's and they all do the same thing.
I haven't played this so I can't really review it my brother seems to like it he hasn't made any complaints it was a Christmas present we got him.

I like it and it lives up to the hype, The only thing that people need to know is that it is very loud. The cooling fan noise is significant, so I don't think that you would want the in a bedroom if you intend to leave it on.
It's a PS4.........what else can I say.  Love it.

The controller is so much better than the PS3, shipping was incredibly fast and i was playing it in a matter of days, it's sleek and looks cool where i have it set up, all games run incredibly smooth the frame rate is at a seamless 60 fps (Frames per second) and the graphics look breathtaking. Gotta love PS4
Great fun and great animations for the games.
I got as a gift for my son's birthday.  he loves all the functionality and gaming abilities.  Would definitely recommend.
The Playstation 4 is a great system and will only get better in time. Be aware that you will need a Playstation Plus membership to play online in most games.

I love this gaming system! The graphics are beautiful, game play is smooth and the new chat feature is fantastic. The voice chat feature is fun and easy to use. I love that an earpiece is included in the box.What I don't like is the absence of the interface that would allow me to stream music and video from the connected computers on my network. (Our media is spread across 4 computers here). If PlayStation wants to be my go-to media device, it will need to step up.The PlayStation camera and voice commands are cool, but limited. I want to tell the PlayStation to turn on from standby mode. It would also be cool if the camera used the facial recognition to sign in the correct user profile when starting.The free 30 PS Plus subscription code did not work on my existing PS Plus account. It did, however work to create a new one.And lastly, the device does not load the downloaded games onto all of the profiles. This causes an immense waste of time. One purchase- everyone should be able to use it.We have been enjoying this gaming system very much and look forward to many years of use.
My son loves this PS4 and won't stop playing it. This was a great investment and thanks for having it available.

Giving it 4 stars since its still lacking features that are not available on it. Features that for me should've been available on day 1.- 3D playback of movies and games: I dont have hundreds of movies in 3D, but I do have several and I would like to play them back as I used to be able to with my PS3- USB Storage Support.... I still don't know why you would put USB 3.0 on a console if its not for data storage.. its not like the controls are going to take advantage of this and charge faster.- Themes... really ? That default theme and music sucks... yes. I can shut it off (the music) but I would really like to be able to maybe have a something else to choose from.These are things that we'll probably have to wait for, but I would've loved not having to have to do so.By the way... we need a poker game ! ... which reminds me, we should be able to play PS3 games that were purchased on PSN. I didnt finish Uncharted 3 prior to selling my PS3.
DO NOT BUY REFURBISHED!  I was sucked in by the lower price and regret it.  Missing cables and a disc drive that does not work.

I ordered my PS4 from Amazon on 12/23 and received it on 12/27/13; safe and sound.  The unit runs like a thing of beauty and I have had no problems since receiving it.  By way of comparison to the PS3, this system is a beast - it runs considerably faster, the controller is much more comfortable and the graphics are an incredible upgrade.  I have been playing Assassins Creed 4 on this unit and the detail in the open-world environment is nothing short of breathtaking.  Although I feel that the PS4 is a considerable upgrade in every aspect over the PS3 alone, if you also have the Playstation Vita, the remote play capabilities are second to none.  You can remotely play your PS4 through the Vita without any notable lag time and only minimal decreased quality in graphics.  I am extremely happy with my purchase and the quality of the Sony products, as well as Amazon's ability to ensure its speedy and safe arrival.

Did not include controller or hdmi cable, but worked great right out of the amazon shipping box. Have not had a problem with operation and worked great with the controller i bought for it. Setup was easy, minor scratches but overall ok.
I'm a ps guy. This system hasn't let me down yet. Graphics are awesome. Designed is perfect. Controllers are very well designed.

i got this on launch day (well....3 days late cause a certain vendor messed up the shipping... )the interface is much nicer than the PS3, and its way faster than the ps3. i see great potential for this system, but the lack of titles at launch was kind of a downer.the controller is a big improvement from the previous generation, should be interesting to see how they integrate the touch pad into future titles. I'm currently only playing call of duty ghosts on it, but i cannot wait for future titles that can take more advantage of the technology.

The new Sony Playstation 4 is such a beautiful machine, the new XMB looks great.Pros:- Great price at just about $400- PS4 is just as small as the PS3 slim (if not smaller) but with a sleeker design.- Graphics are much better then its predecessor.- No "HUGE" brick for power supply- Controller feels natural in my hands- Still plays blu-rays, still comes standard with a rechargable wireless bluetooth controller, and still able to connect just about any bluetooth headset available on the marketCons:- Sold out in minutes- Playstation plus is required ONLY for playing online "multiplayer"- I don't like the new joysticks (indention's throws my aim off)- Not much games (to be expected at launch)
This is the first PlayStation I've ever bought, and I love it. It runs great, the software is nice, I have no complaints at all.
Arrived on time, and as described. Nothing wrong with it at all.

The system's Operating System is so much faster and more responsive than the PS3 was. Everything is snappy and easy to navigate and switching between a game, the OS, and back again is instantaneous.. The hardware is powerful and even launch games have impressive visuals. The Dualshock 4 is a HUGE improvement over the Dualshock 3, with its larger size, better analog sticks and triggers, and more comfortable grips making it already my favorite controller ever. The system is compact and really well designed - it's even smaller than my PS3 slim that it sits next to! Overall, a fantastic system that improves on the PS3 in every aspect.Pros:+++Hardware Design and Specs+++Dualshock 4 (Everything about it except battery)++Operating System design and responsiveness (including in-game)++Party chat FINALLY comes to Playstation++The 3.5mm headset jack allows you to play with earbuds when you don't want to use a full headset or TV speakers++The improved PSN user pages add a personal touch to your friends list; it even uses real names if you request it from your friend.+Standby mode allowing controllers to charge and items to download+The launch lineup is much better than some people give it credit! Both this and the Xbox One are launching with a COD, AC, Battlefield, and sports games (NBA 2K14 is excellent). Killzone: Shadow Fall is very fun and beautiful as well.Cons:--No way to change PSN ID still--Trophies still require syncing (although it is much faster on PS4 than PS3)-Dualshock 4 battery life is much less than the (excellent) Dualshock 3 battery life-Should ship with a  higher quality 1TB hard drive. Even some people that are putting a 1TB 5400 RPM drive in (should be a lateral move speed wise with the stock 5400RPM drive) are noticing respectable load time decreases over the stock drive.

So far, SO impressed. I've been a Playstation guy since the original came out. Never have opted to move to XBox because Playstation is just awesome. And once again, they came up with a VERY impressive system. This doesn't look as "sexy" as the original PS 3 in Piano Black Finish...this is alternatively sort of plain looking with a cool multi color light going up the middle. But regardless of that, this is a powerhouse of a machine. It does so much and is VERY fast.With these types of systems that connect to the internet, they need to move fast or you'd be sitting there forever. This is very fast. The graphics and game play are fantastic and I couldn't recommend this more.My PS 3 lasted for 7 years, so I hope this one will too!

I bought this on Amazon.  I also purchased XB1 via Microsoft, I would have purchased PS4 via Sony, but they sent me here when it was announced.  All in all, despite all the hiccups, which occur with any launch of virtually everything, this machine is great, and I think Sony sees potential and builds that in so we may not see all the fanfare when we see the white PS sign in the load up, I'm sure things will constantly evolve.  I own all the systems, I'm a gamer.  PC as well, everything.  I enjoy it.  It is not my life, but when I want to play what Sony has or Xbox or Wii have or even the 3DS, I do my research and follow my gamer instincts; how zen.Games I purchased at Amazon with the buy 2 get one free: Knack (a bit ps3 in graphics), but Kill Zone for the PS4 is brilliant and looks next gen.  Marvel Lego - it's on all the machines, so I'm sure each will have their flaws, but for the first party games, Kill Zone is the better of the lot.BTW: my PS4 works, just as my XB1 works.  I feel bad some of either, did not arrive working.  And I can only hope that all gets fixed.  We must remind ourselves we are gamers and we KNOW these things happens, it's not fun when it happens to us, but it will get fixed.  Change your stars then.  I'm giving both my XB1 and PS4, each 5 stars because I'm a gamer, I want to play and I want what is new and fresh and feels next gen.Controller is much better than PS3, I will admit.  I like both new console's new looks.  We have to think, what if they didn't update them, just the console...but they need to be updated, that's the point - next gen.  I wish both consoles had backward compatibility, but who am I kidding, I'll play some PS3 and 360 games a little longer, but I'm moving forward, I do not touch my PS1 or PS2 or original Xbox or Saturn or Dreamcast or Wii...not since I have Wii U, XB1 and PS4 now...why should I?  I want to remember fondly how fun Nightmare Creatures was, how fun the very first Tomb Raider was, not look back and say OMG..."ain't nobody got time for that".  So let's move forward... you can't wear the shirt you wore in 4th grade anymore...time to graduate to what is next.  Maybe I'll go back for nostalgia one day :)Remind yourself we are a small community of gamers; let's respect each other and hope for what is to come because the visionaries that create these consoles do it for us... it's a wonderful time in gaming history.  Let's just play and have fun and those negatives that want to come out of our mouths - maybe we should take a moment and play the games, isn't that the point?  Game on! PS Wii U Super Mario 3D World game...brilliant fun!

Very satisfied. I am happy I was able to find it on amazon since it could not be found anywhere else. The console came in 2 days later after purchased and my experience with amazon keeps getting better every time

I received this on launch day and haven't had any issues with it so far.  I wanted to wait a bit to make sure the system was stable before posting a review.Here's what I love:  The interface is wonderful.  It's simple, straightforward and easy to navigate once you dive in.  If you're in a game, you can pop out to the menu and back in without much hassle.  I also enjoy the party chat features.  The other night I played a round of Killzone online with a friend and we chatted away while playing and when we were both doing our own thing.  I like how speedy game installs go off the discs and how quickly you can get into a game.  The playgo feature when you download a game is pretty sweet as well - just a couple hours after initializing my download of Knack I was able to play the initial chapters.Here's what I like:  The share button has a lot of potential.  I've taken a few snapshots and uploaded them to Facebook and the quality was pretty great.  I haven't done much with the video functionality yet so I can't report on that.  I like the social functions, but it could definitely use some filters so you can weed out information you may not be looking to see.  It will be a lot more robust when more of my friends have moved onto the PlayStation 4 as it obviously doesn't track PS3 activity.Here's what I'm not sure about:  Standby mode seems to be working fine, but I have yet for it to download game patches while in standby.  It did download firmware 1.51 and it was ready for me to install when I turned the system on (like the PS3), so that was quite nice.  I'm looking forward to when you can go into standby and suspend a game.To be honest, I have thoroughly enjoyed my experience with the PS4.  It's a solid system, and I highly anticipate what's to come over the course of its lifecycle.  Don't let the stories of broken machines keep you from getting on something great.  I couldn't recommend this higher!

Ive had my ps4 for about 2 weeks now and it is amazing. So fast and smooth, like every next gen console its slow to pick up. But the ps4 came in running with momentum so within the next year or so the ps4 should be running smooth and when that happens all ill be ready. So I do recommend buying the ps4 just because the future for it will be awesome and you don't wanna get left out from history!

I'll keep it short. The PS4 is an amazing piece of hardware. The graphics are stunning and so detailed. Granted I haven't played all the games yet but they ones I have are amazing. Tomb Raider being a favorite of mine. The system is also easy to set up and looks cool with this slanted design. Definitely happy with my purchase and can't wait for more games to come out for this next gen system!

No video game system launch ever goes off without a hitch. But despite the initial hiccups of the PS4 launch, i am a satisfied customer. Although I have to say that 1) I did not encounter the so called "blue light of death" that some had to deal with and 2) I only intended to play one game, so I'm not disappointed with the dearth of next gen games (next year or so could be another story). As for certain multimedia capabilities,  I'm not as worried. It has Netflix, Amazon and Hulu...so most people (like me) are covered for now. I'm sure they will expand on services and all that in the not too distant future. For now gaming is where the PS4 is at, and they have me there already.

Best console made too date, graphics are mind boggling the ability too upgrade the hdd is a breeze, Sony outdid themselves. this console is fantastic the games are awesome killzone is the best game available during the initial launch.

Great Christmas gift years ago.

Sony just does things right. You have to consider they have been making hardware for nearly 70 years and they also have been making PC's for upwards of 15 or more. You get to realize why they've been in business so long. The console is sleek, the dashboard is beautiful, maybe not Microsoft beautiful but very easy to use and very intuitive. When I go back and play my PS3, it's night and day and you realize the console is "next gen". Boot up times are faster, graphics are crisp, hard drive is hefty and most of the launch games run 1080p and either 60 or 30fps. Considering this console is to last us another decade or so, I don't want my games to be "upscaled" to 1080p from 720p. Not to say it's future proof but it does boast some impressive internals. I had no issues aside from having to plug it in to a somewhat empty power strip. It is after all in a way a small computer in terms of power usage. Great controller, solid as a rock and a bit bigger than the older ones. You can game for a couple hours and not have your hands cramp up. Solid launch line up and with them dropping games to download for free if you're a PS Plus member almost every week is just an added bonus. For $50 dollars a month extra it's still under the price point of the competitor and you get loads of discounts, on top of which they threw in a free 3 months for first time buyers. For the price and the features, in my mind it's unbeatable. Happy Holidays!!!!!

Great piece of tech and the games selection - while small at the moment - is great. A few quirks on some of the functionality:- using the Playstation app on my tablet requires that the PS4 is set to use a wireless network instead of using bluetooth.- remote play or 2nd screen functionality with a Vita does not allow streaming video functionality- minor settings that would be nice to adjust:  - being able to disable the light on the dualshock controller  - being able to disable the BEEP when the console turns on (or not beep when turning on using a controller)- also waiting for a 1st party media remote. I hear the 3rd party remotes are OK, but seems strange they didn't work on one for when this releasedMinor nitpicks, and mostly just different ways of doing things from my Xbox 360.

Many people are reported to having problems with their PS4. My friend was one of them. However, the Sony Store managed to replace his console immediately. I, on the other hand, had 0 problems out of the box. The PS4 is slick, quick, and incredibly powerful. The interface can get a bit messy at times, but overall its a huge improvement over the PS3's interface.If you're on the fence on getting the PS4 due to reported defects, keep in mind the actual percentage of people having problems is around .03%.Regardless, the launch lineup is nothing to be impressed about, but here's to the future.PROS:Game run smoothly and look amazing. Battlefield 4 runs at 1080p with 60 FPS.UI is slick and way better than the PS3's (needs QoL fixes though)Incredibly powerful system. You can switch between apps pretty fast, and trophies load way faster than on the PS3.New trophy system is amazing.Really easy to swap out HDDs.The controller is the best yet.Playstation+ offerings are great. Resogun is tons of fun, and Contrast is a unique experience.Party Chat is great and allows you to easily voice chat with your friends.You can use your phone/tablet as a second screen.CONS:Buggy/sluggish at times, but very rarely and only on certain menus.Apps like Amazon Instant Video freeze the console occasionally.UI could still use some work. Need to be able to organize trophies/games/etc better.Launch line-up is underwhelming and doesn't show off the console's powerful potential.

I purchased the PS4 on day one as I am an avid gamer. The system gets a 4 star because in my opinion it builds upon everything that made the PS3 great. I am withholding giving it a 5 star due to the lack of games at the moment (early adopter I know), and some of the media features that were present on PS3 are not available now.The XMB is MUCH faster than before, and much faster than XB1. I give it the edge over XB1 because the system is focused on just being a games system and does it well. In my experience It has not froze or experieced some of the quirks of apps not doing what you expect (looking at you XB1). I currently have Killzone (great), AC4 (decent), Madden (decent, not a big jump over previous gen), and Resogun (great).So all in all very solid start from Sony and I know that it will continue to improve.

I don't post many reviews but I wanted to go ahead on this one and offset all the complaints I'm seeing out there. I got my system, took about ten minutes to set it up and it has worked basically flawlessly. I have frozen two times on the first 2 days both times due to high volume PSN problems. Never had the update bog down because I went ahead and downloaded the update to a memory stick and booted in safe mode to install my update. Took 3 minutes.I see people worried because 750 people have reviewed because theirs was faulty. But stop and think, how many people are just like me and never review the things they get that work perfectly. How many review the things that are broken? A brand new system has a few issues- shocker !!! System is a great improvement on PS3 and as more games come available will prove it's worth. Also, PS Plus is great and several of the free games are amazing.

Truly one of the best VIDEO GAME consoles from Sony. In case you didn't catch it I capitalized "Video Game Console" because unlike their competition Sony built a great gaming machine. Sony really dug dip when designing this console and it is very easy to see that they finally reached out to what people had disliked about the ps3.One of the biggest changes you will notice is the controller. I personally never had a problem with the dualshock 3 being to small like other. For those that disliked the dualshock 3 will be happy to hear that the new dualshock 4 is a gamechanger. It's larger, more weighty, improved triggers(fps games), and the analog sticks have a hybrid design using both convex and concave.Now for the console. What can I say. It's been nothing short of amazing. The UI takes the ps3 xmb and gives it a drastic overhaul. The specs that Sony chose have all been top notch except for the 500gb hdd. The positive to this is that Sony allows you to upgrade your hard drive without voiding the warranty. In the end its faster, more powerful, and cheaper that their competion(XBOX One).For those having difficulty choosing a next gen system heres my short break-down.PS4-faster, cheaper,more powerful and a dedicated Gaming machine with decent entertainment supportXBOXONE- slower, more expensive, 50% less powerful than ps4,#GreatnessAwaits

As a gamer I've been all over the place as far as what system I've owned, in what generation.My mom bought me the PS1 (I was like 7-8 and the PS2 was already out lol) so I was a bit late to the party. Then I had a PS2 a few years later; & that was without a doubt Sony's golden age, where anyone who cared to play video games pretty much had one, or had a friend / family member who did.Last Gen. I made an interesting choice considering which 2 consoles I'd owned previously, I EXCLUSIVELY played on the Xbox 360 *ducks* and never owned a PS3 for even a second! I don't believe in brand loyalty, or fanboy-ism so my choice in siding with Sony this time around comes from realizing this was the best option for GAMING vs. owning an Xbox One.I won't go into why I feel the PS4 is the superior console, but rest assured you won't be disappointed for the next 6+ years until their 5th console arrives on store shelves! .. or Amazon ^-^

What can I say about the next generation console? It's pretty amazing. From the fast processing, to the set up on the main screen and it is so easy to navigate. The controller is much easier too instead of having the start and select buttons you have the pad to tap and it brings up everything that the start and select button would have in the past. I would suggest getting a charging station along with the console and it's a shame that the camera didn't come with the system. I am excited to play other games on this system such as Infamous Second Son, Watch Dogs, Shadow of Mordor, Destiny, and many more.
Very satisfied with the product, my grandson is so happy.
I had to have one and I'm happy with it. I like the design, style, size, arrangement of the console better than the original PS3 I had. Obviously the new games make it even better.

System is great, graphics are great, only issues are a lack of titles, backward compatibility and the Playstation Network.Titles are coming, so that's cool. Backward compatibility was already disclosed, so that's just a wish, but PSN being necessary for online play is something different.If PSN were still free, I could deal with the outages and downtime, but now that I'm paying for it? No. This needs Sony full attention.
I recommand it for young and adult as well. I spend my free time by playing with it without any technical problem as I noticed that in my old Play Station.

This console is my 1st experience with a PS system as I have been an Xbox person for the last 10 years. Have to say I am blown away by the capabilities of this console and cant wait for the truly next gen games to arrive.BTW, Ignore the Xbox fanboz and their one star ratings. This thing is so fast compared to my ps3.I wish it had backwards compatability but, I still have a ps3 sitting beside it, so I guess that is ok.The only drawback at the moment is that there are relatively few games.

I pre-ordered my PS4 the day it was announced. For a while, I wondered if I should have pre-ordered it from a local store but I'm glad I didn't. I received it around 9 am on release day and have been enjoying it since.Though I heard/read some people had issues with their PS4s, I haven't had a single one even though my PS4 gets used daily.My PS4 is extremely quiet. I have a Super Slim PS3 (also purchased through Amazon) and even though it's quiet, the PS4 makes it sound like a noisy beast (it's not).Even though I had no complaints regarding the Dual Shock 3, the Dual Shock 4 is a big improvement. Initially it felt weird using the R2 as the trigger in shooting games but it didn't take me very long to get used to it.It's funny how many anti-PlayStation people made such a big deal about the light on the front of the controller. Even though I always play in a completely dark room, it doesn't affect or bother me at all. In fact, I like it because it allows me to find things (cellphone, TV remote) without having having to turn on the lights.

With the free overnight Shipping and 2 games included, I couldn't pass up the opportunity to finally get a next generation console. Having it for about a week now I am completely impressed.Console came with A digital download of the Last Of Us. I had played through this on my PS3, It was one of my favorite games that I've played and will definitely play through it again.It also came with a code to download one of four games. I chose Far Cry 4 and have to say it's amazing. The graphics are out of this world.The new controller is very cool. It took a little while to get used to the touch pad, but it became second nature after a couple of days.It does have a 500 GB hard drive, but with the size of games anymore, I am thinking of upgrading that to a 2TB drive. It's definitely a plus that Sony will allow you to add a different hard drive.I usually wait a year or so after a new console comes out so that any issues can be worked out, and also because it seems like a while before games really start coming out for a new system.All in all I am really happy with the new system. I cannot wait for several games that are going to come out in 2015. Namely, Dying Light, The Order: 1886 and Uncharted 4, a Thief's end. It will definitely be a happy year of gaming.
Amazing console and it arrived in less than 24 hours!

Last Gen i owned all the three consoles. PS3, XBOX360 and Wii. I played Wii the least followed by PS3 and then XBOX 360. I was confused as to which system i should start this gen with. Though XBONE had lot of gimmicky features, i decided to settle with PS4 because of the superior graphics on 3rd party titles. The system is functioning perfectly well as a gaming console (i didnt buy it for using apps and streaming stuffs, i have other gadgets to do that). I am playing Shadow of mordor and Infamous second son. And the games are visually much much much better than the last gen. I would suggest that if you are really interested in gaming, then buy this console. If you need it for other purposes like streaming, skype etc. then buy XBONE.

everything is awesome 500g very quite only thing is that it doesn't come with a cam & and it doesn't have playstation home:( so i got to keep jumping back and forth from ps4 to ps3 but other than that its great

Such an amazing console.  This console was built with gaming in mind unlike the Xbox One which can't touch the graphics quality of the PS4.  If you're getting a nextgen console the PS4 should be your choice.

Was able to order PS4 on 12/3 when there was a short window of stock. Although I must admit I've been a lifetime Sony/PS fan (as far as consoles go), I'm very impressed with the PS4. The UI is clean and simple, setup was a breeze, and graphics/gameplay are a big step up from the previous generation. I've also noticed that Sony's online store in the console is much more responsive than it was for the PS3 which is nice because I felt like purchasing games on the previous console was a pain. Additionally the new controller offers everything to like about the old (PS3) controller with a few significant improvements namely: better grips, improved triggers and joysticks, etc. Lastly the console's sharing features are tightly integrated and are easy to use.Overall, would recommend the PS4 to a friend.

I'm not one to usually post reviews but thought I would make an exception...I received my PS4 on launch day, no issues.  The packing was sufficient but I would have liked a little bit more padding on the bottom to protect if it took a big drop.I had previously received my extra controllers and PS4 camera so I was ready to go.  Setup was quick and easy but I was a bit confused about power on as I didn't realize the power button was in the little vertical slot on the front of the unit.  There is no physical power toggle on the back of the unit like with the PS3 to hard power off the unit, instead when shutting down you have standby or power off options.Face recognition for login works great and is very helpful if you have kids playing! I can just hand them controllers it picks up their faces and they are off and running using their own profiles.I haven't had any issues with PSN login or any games and so far am really enjoying the experience.  I also have to say the new PS camera is a huge improvement over the PS3 version.The controllers feel good in my hands and my kids have been able to operate them easily also.There are some differences I am still adapting to... The lack of start/select buttons instead having an options and share button is taking some getting used to.  It was nice to see that my PSN account carried over all my information as should be expected...

the only question you have to ask when deciding weather or not to buy this is, "are you a gamer?"  I'll probably get grilled by some xbox fanboy about this review, but the facts are the facts.  This is the superior piece of hardware, and with an easier system to develop for without all of the restrictions of the Xbox one.  The simple thing is it is a better piece of hardware than it's competition, that crossed with all of the restrictions and forced extras.  I'll openly admit I am somewhat biased, I have always had sony consoles, however that said I am also the kind of person that goes for the best system regardless of manufacturer, and I have had the last two generations of Xbox as well.  Just save yourself the frustration and get the Playstation.
The graphics are great but the sound coming from it is very loud. I purchased this 2 years ago and wish I could trade it for a working one.

Even better than I thought!  I can't wait for the PS Store to have more items though, but it's all in the making right now.  Also, be advised, the low-star ratings come from malfunctioning units.  With over a million units being sold in preorder and on launch day, there were bound to be issues.  4,000 units were reported as malfunctioning.  4,000 out of a 1 million?  That means out of a 1,000,000 consoles manufactured, 0.4% malfunctioned.  Overall, the system is pretty amazing.  PC gamers feel like it's outdated, but not everyone wants to press keys when you can have more control with the controller.  I feel it's a great investment, whether you're playing or buying for children.

I give it 5 stars because from day 1 of purchase to today it has been a flawlessly workign system. I know some people have had issues with their systems (i.e. disc drives, blue light of death, etc.) but that is to be expected on a new launch. Mine, fotunately had none of those issues and despite lacking a large library of games to choose from (another expectation at a new launch), it has provided me with some great hours of game play.I recommend this system to hard core gamers and people that don't care so much for the "1 box meets the needs of everyone in the family's living room" type of system. This system is mine and is not shared with the family. If I were wanting a system that streams movies, navigates my cable box, video chats with family from the comfort of the couch, plays music at a party and also plays a variety of games I would probably have chosen an Xbox One. I wanted a system focused on games and games alone for a good price and I think I got exactly what I wanted. Sony's focus at E3 was obviously pointed toward games and I think they are sticking with that mantra. This isn't for everyone but it's what I think you should think about if you're trying to decide between the two top systems. Xbox One is a great system from what I've seen but I don't have a cable box near my gaming system. If my gaming system was in my living room, where my family congregates, I would have thought highly about getting the XB1. I do like the instant snapping between TV and Gaming, skype easily on the tv is nice too. All that stuff I might buy into sometime later when the console is cheaper. For now, I want my games and I want them my way.My only gripe at this point is the lack of games. It's also a little louder than the XB1 but it's certainly nothing to get upset about as it's not as loud as the previous gen. Also, the matte finished side is great but the shiny side is susceptible to getting lots of fingerprints (I wipe it down and dust the inside out weekly as it sits next to my tv in plain view and I like it looking good). All in all, it's worth the money.

Not a whole lot to say other than I've been playing Assassin's Creed 4 and absolutely loving it. Graphics are noticeably better, the environment and lighting show so much more detail than ever before. I can't wait to see how far developers push this new platform.

Sony delivered again!!  This is much more than a Video Game Console.  You can turn it on and log into Nextflix,Redbox, PlayStation Music and much more on this multimedia console.  With a 500GB hard drive you have more than enough room to save progress in your games or get a digital copy of a game if you decide to go that route.  The graphics are phenomenal and very realistic.  The Blu-Ray player is just another addition that makes this great as you can watch Blu-Rays on your PS4 and if you have a 1080P TV and a good stereo system, it looks and feels like you are in a movie theatre.  I would recommend this over the XBox One from what I've read and heard from friends that decided to go with Michrosoft, almost all of them had buyers remorse.  This is much more than a game console as I said as there are lots of apps you can run on the PS4.  Also if you become a part of the online community, there are games you can play that are geared towards online play and it's amazing how realistic they made the online gaming.  You can win trophies for individual games and also trophies when playing online, which makes it fun and incentive to reach goals.  I don't have anything bad to say about this system, and the controller is easy to use, even if you haven't used a PlayStation controller before and on some games, the controller shakes when you get hit or there is something around you that would make you shake in the game.  The controller also has a light sensor on the top of it, which lights up in some games, such as Grand Theft Auto, when the cops are on your trail.  It's a neat addition feature in my mind.  I hope this review has been helpful and those who buy the PlayStation 4 on Amazon will love it as much as I do!!

As a lifelong Playstation user, I am impressed with the gaming capabilities of the PS4.  I'm a casual user and can definitely tell the difference in terms of graphics and flow of the two games I've played (FIFA 14' & Assassins Creed IV).  Future games will probably unlock the real value of the PS4, but for now it has everything a gaming console should.

I love this console and the moment I picked it up, I began to drool.  It looks pretty damn nice and the fact that it's smaller the PS3 Slim is impressive considering this is the first generation PS4 console for the most part and not the Slim variant.  Kudos to Sony for this.  So let's go over the pros and cons because as much as I love this console, there are bound to be some problems over the long run.  Keep in mind that my pros and cons are based on my observations and everyone's thoughts will vary.PROS:- Sleek and modern look- Replaceable HDD (you can even swap it with an SSD for some better performance).- Easy ability to broadcast on certain services (Twitch, UStream, etc.)- Dualshock 4 controller is definitely a step up from the Dualshock 3.  Feels a lot more solid and has so much more functions.  You can listen to in-game audio through the 3.5mm headphone jack located on the controller.  A step up from the PS3.- Certain games allow you to use the Dualshock 3 controller if you want to use it.  The Dualshock 4 is also able to be used on the PS3.CONS:- No backwards compatibility with PS3 games.- The LED light on the Dualshock 4 controller can be a little bit annoying if you have a glossy screen television.- The glossy plastic part that covers the HDD can attract a lot of dust.Overall, these are my viewpoints of this after using the PS4 for some time.  I can't wait to play more games on this console.  Especially the new exclusives that are coming out later in the year.

I have read a bunch of horror stories about a blinking blue light and thankfully never had that problem, knock on wood. I received mine on Friday 11-15 as promised and opened it up. The packaging definitely lacked by Sony but Amazon had it in a larger box with packing bubbles so there was no shipping damage. Plugged it in, established my internet connection, set up my PlayStation Plus account, and proceeded to load my games.The games load smoothly enough, I opted to let them load and install before attempting to play. I like how you can enter the dashboard without exiting your game. It paused it and when you click on the icon to reenter, it is instantaneous right where you left off. I did find that I had to be closed out of the game program in order to browse the PlayStation Network Store, so if you don't think the Store is working, close your game.The graphics on games such as Battlefield 4, Killzone, and Assassins Creed are pretty incredible and Knack is quite fun. Every game ran very smoothly and I never even noticed it saving. The controller is more comfortable than I imagined it would be. It is smooth yet grips your hands and the joysticks contours are great. I like the changes with L2 and R2 a lot. They are way more comfortable and pressure sensitive and the entire controller is super responsive.I like my PS4 very much. The only criticism I have is that the User Interface is a little lackluster. But it is straight forward. I like how when you select a game and push down, without entering the game, it gives you info and game stats and multiplayer map info and game control info etc...Overall I am completely satisfied with my purchase. I hope all the issues get resolved for everyone and they don't loose faith in it. It is great.

I've had zero problems with the console itself. It's the controllers that are bad news. After 2 weeks of playing, my right trigger got sticky and stopped working for like 2 days. It's really loose now and feels like it will break off.The rubber padding on the joysticks wear out too quickly. I don't even play everyday and my padding still is halfway off. Other than those things, the console is great.

Hardware:+ Slick, compact & quiet.+ No power brick.+ The new controller is awesome! For me last-gen was all about the 360 controller. Wasn't that fond of the DS3, but the DS4 is one of the most comfortable controllers I've used. Great for shooters too.- Power and eject buttons are tiny, had to scratch my head to figure it out.UI:+ Much better than the PS3 & 360. It might look similar to PS3's XMB, but it's far more functional.+ Jumping between games and OS is blazingly fast.+ Switching apps is seamless.- My only real complaint is no customization.Features:+ PS4 is a social box. This is where Sony has been very forward thinking.+ Twitch integration is awesome! You can literally start broadcasting at any point. I've had friends watching my feed on cell phones and other devices. Never thought i'd use it but it's quiet awesome.+ All your friends have an activity feed, you can see what they're up to & watch their streams.+ PSN finally has an Xbox Live style party system, unified voice-chat! It all works seamlessly.+ Managing multiple accounts is quite simple.+ Background downloading is just awesome.What to expect at launch:+ The 1.50 Firmware update can be downloaded while you play games.+ The launch lineup is decent.+ Free games, of which Resogun is the killer app.- DLNA ( media server ) features are not included at launch, but are coming in an update ( confirmed by Sony ).- There are some PSN outages due to the high volume of traffic right now. But it hasn't affected my ability to play and stream stuff.

Ordered my PS4 on the day of launch, got to my home a day later.  Great system, very fast menu's, launching games, and moving from various content.  I logged into my Plus account and the system brought over my trophies from PS3 etc. very nice integration.  Played Killzone and have to say that this is by far the best controller I have ever used, its comfortable, balanced well, responsive, and the new touchpad is integrated rather well.  Other cool features with the controller are that the LED changes color based on input from the game, starts to turn red when you are hurt, green when you are outside, etc. and there is a speaker in the controller which when I picked up an audio file within the game, it played through my controller like I had picked it up myself.  The visuals of the games are amazing, the lighting is by far the most realistic I have ever seen, where you can see dust sparkle when light through a window hits it etc.I have seen some negative ratings coming from those that received defective systems and that's unfortunate, with a large scale undertaking of putting our over a million units, the law of nature is that there are going to be a small percentage that will not work or have issues.  I am sure Sony/Amazon etc. will work with those that have problems, but don't let that taint your perception of the system and/or Sony at least they are not jamming TV watching and football down your throat like Xbox is.  This is a Coke/Pepsi, Mac/Pc type of thing, if you were an xbox owner before you will probably get an xbox, and PS owners will get the PS4 and that's fine, but if you want to focus on games, I am happy with the PS4 and the slight edge that is has over the Xbox one (with RAM type/speed mostly) and the developers that Sony kept in the loop as they developed the system.  Sony has learned from their mistakes, as for Microsoft they tend to do what they want and its not always in the right direction, just look at Windows 8 (or every other version of windows over the years that was a steaming pile of dung).  Sony had a plan, put a good system together and MS came out with a bunch of rules on their system and has since been trying to backtrack and fix their poor system plan (used games, always online, to name a few).In the grand scheme of things, a year down the road, we will have both systems running side by side and those on either side of the fence, I chose my side day 1 and am happy with the decision.I still have my original PS3 launch system, works perfect, and that was a complicated system to manufacture, this PS4 is like a new PC, so I am looking to a long life cycle with the PS4 as well.enjoy....

Amazon part of the review: Received my PS4 on the date promised by Amazon and the packaging was very well done (lots of bubble wrap). Thank you Amazon - you get a gold star!PS4 review: Hooked up my PS4 with no issues and it ran me through the initial setup.  Everything worked as expected. I did run into one small glitch trying to do the update. I first tried it through the system notifications, and it only downloaded the update, but wouldn't install it (kept saying "Preparing for installation..."). I then tried it through the "System Update" option and everything was fine. The download itself was a lot faster than downloading updates on the PS3.If there's one word I can use to describe the PS4, it's "Smooth".  Everything, from the setup, the interface, the integration with my PSN and Facebook account, and the games are super smooth. Cold boot times for me (to the point of selecting a user) is sub 20 seconds.  From standby mode it's about 12 seconds. And don't underestimate the improvements to the controller - I really had no idea they could make such a positive change. It really has to be used to be believed.I've been through a couple 12+ hours playing sessions, and my PS4 has performed flawlessly. It barely gets warm, and it is extremely quiet (I can't hear it at all and it sits about 6-8 feet from me). I've also played online, and although my internet connection is pretty poor, I had great response times and no trouble with connection drops so it appears the PSN network is improved over my experiences with the PS3.There's a lot to like here and won't go into everything. All in all I'm extremely pleased. I'll update this review after about a month especially if any problems develop.

My system was luckily shipped with a few other items I ordered so it was protected quite well. It booted up properly and the update took less than 3 minutes in total. The PSN network was a little bogged down so it too me some time to login. However, I was able to play my game immediately while waiting for a PSN connection. The system itself is very quiet and though does get warm I was able to play it for 12 hours without an issue. When turned on it takes a minute to boot up. The UI is very simple an beautifully designed. I am not bombarded by adds and can find my game of choice quickly. The graphics are amazing and I have yet to see a frame rate issue. It is very powerful. I was a xbox exclusive person and am glad i made the switch.

Arrived prompt and in impeccable condition. Great job AmazonI have always felt comfortable shopping on amazon, and will continue to do so.I also have an Xbox One and after spending some time on both systems I have really enjoyed they layout on the PS4.It is simple and clean, improved from the PS3 (in my opinion)Both systems are great and have their strengths and weaknesses.I really like that I can stream movies through Netflix or Amazon on the PS4 without having to pay additional fees (must have Xbox live to stream movies through apps like Netflix on Xbox One).I also like That the PS4 controller comes with a built in rechargeable lithium-ion battery (Xbox you have to buy a separate rechargeable pack).These are just some small differences, but add up in the end.Graphically speaking games look fantastic on both consoles.Right now the largest problem with the PS4 is lack of Games.While both systems are new and lack a large library of games to choose from,In my opinion the Xbox One has more interesting selection of games, and my kids love the Kinect on the Xbox One.

I pre-ordered the PS4 system the hour they were available to pre-order and I picked Amazon because I could get launch day delivery. I waited all day, finally it came, I hooked it up and it ran great. I bought three games for it an started playing all of them.The second day started some issues with connecting to my HDTV. It would say "no connection". Then a week or less later it would freeze up, make a horrible noise and shutdown or restart just after a few minutes of gameplay. It also did this out of the games, just if I was sitting at the main PS4 menu. Now it's completely locked up and I can't turn it on and there is no video or audio at all. Luckily I was able to get in and delete my user settings and profile before it completely bricked up on me. Amazon said they have replacements, so I'll be sending my bricked up unit back and be getting a replacement.So, my PS4 symptoms are:Power issuesVideo connection issuesFreezing, jolting and just shutting downFinny noises coming from the unitBesides that, the system is amazing. I played Killzone, Assassin's Creed and CoD Ghosts. All looked and ran amazing! Short loading times and I love the controller. The touchpad is a really nice feature.Everyone with a system should we cautious of these issues as I didn't start having major issues until a week later. Also, Sony says the power issues effected like 1-4% of the one-million systems sold. So others should not be discouraged from purchase the system based off a few issues. I'm a PlayStation user all the way and I must say this system is amazing and they did everything right.Highly recommended!*UPDATE*I received my new PS4 system from Amazon the next business day. I hooked everything up and it's working great! The first thing I noticed was that it is quieter than my defective system, which makes me think it was an issue with the power supply, possibly over-heating. Just like the PS3, the PS4 saved my trophies, however I lost all my game install information, saves, and updates. over-all I am very happy with Amazon's speed to get me a replacement, they paid for shipping back of my old unit, and I'm just happy my new system works.***UPDATE*** 26 May 2014My PS4 just started a new issue this past weekend. During gameplay, or whenever a disc is in the system, the PS4 will beep and just kick it out. I looked it up and many others have also had this issue. I will be contacting Sony for a replacement or repair. It has been perfect since my first replacement, now it looks like I will be going to my 3rd PS4. The PS4 is still and will always be an amazing system, despite the little issues I have had. Remember, the flame which burns twice as bright only burns half as long. I will keep this review updated once I have more information.****UPDATE**** The ejecting of the disc on my PS4 is due to the little rubber foot directly below the eject button. This rubber foot pushes up on the button ejecting anything you have in there. To fix it, I simply pulled a piece of the rubber foot back and folded it under the PS4. If I had this standing vertically, I may not have had this issue as the rubber wouldn't be compressed. Regardless, the issue is fixed and that is how to correct it if you have similar issues.

Purchased from amazon when I could not find any local. Works perfect. Streams better than its predecessor. Multitasking is excellent and the ability to kill apps including games when they freeze is awesome. No more forced reboots during errors. Extremely quite. Do not even notice it when the system is on. Auto updates. Only reason I gave it a 4 star was the lack of 3D support. Unless this is updated via a system update I will have to keep this a 4 star. Love it however for online gaming and streaming. Would recommend to anyone.

I love the PS4. I think it is a worthwhile upgrade over the PS3 which was already a great system to begin with. The system is fast fluid and responsive. The 8GB of GDDR5 ram really make the system snappy and speedy when opening apps and or games. My only gripe is the size of games that install. With the 6x BD-Rom in the system it should be much faster than the 2x in the PS3 which means developers should be able to stream data off the disc specially with how fast that main system ram is.

Even though the software is still on its infant stages the console itself keeps showing why it is ahead of the pack with every update. It has worked very consistent over the 600+ hours I have used it with only 1 hard freeze which was caused by the game Warframe. The remote does die faster than the one its predecessor had possibly because of the light that comes in it which remains always on. All in all it is a great system with a promising future if the developer take advantage of the hardware and its many features.
Bought new when first released and still work wonderfully. Has had a ton of use. Multiple hours a day I watching TV, movies or playing games. No problems.

A couple things are still lacking with the PS4.Game selection:Getting better later this year, sure.  However the lack of titles from the PS3 that are available in the online store is kind of annoying.  I really would like to catch up on Uncharted or relive my Kingdom Hearts days.  So far this is not possible.Playstation plus:All you really get is a few deals and 3 free games a month that are really just PS Vita games.  I wish I hadn't paid for it yet.Form Factor:Why are there no standard USB ports on the back of the system?Why is the option button so hard to press?All that said, I think the system shows a lot of promise.  It's fast as hell, pumps out some really clean, awesome graphics, and the controller feels almost weightless in your hands (at the cost of battery life, to be sure). I can't wait until they really put some work into the playstation store and get it up to speed with this generation.
